President Donald Trump told reporters Wednesday afternoon that what he called the “fake dossier” was “made up.” | Mark Wilson/Getty Images Trump calls dossier 'disgrace' after reports that Democrats helped fund research

President Donald Trump on Wednesday called a now-famous dossier on alleged ties between his 2016 campaign and the Russian government a “disgrace” to Democrats and hinted that he knows the identity of a Republican who initially paid for the research during the GOP primary.

Now it’s turning out that the hoax is turned around, and you look at what’s happened with Russia and you look at the uranium deal and you look at the fake dossier, so that’s all turned around.”

House Republicans launched a pair of probes into the FBI’s handling of the bureau’s investigation into Clinton’s use of a private email server and an unrelated uranium deal struck during her tenure as secretary of state.

Hillary Clinton’s presidential campaign and the Democratic National Committee helped fund research that led to the dossier, news organizations reported Tuesday, though the research initially was paid for by an as-yet unnamed Republican.

Trump has raised questions about the deal, particularly after reports the FBI was investigating a Russian bribery plot at the same time that the sale of uranium production facilities to a Kremlin-linked firm was approved.

Trump told reporters Wednesday afternoon that what he called the “fake dossier” was “made up.”

“I understand they paid a tremendous amount of money,” Trump told reporters outside the White House.

You’ll be surprised.”

Trump, who has said for months that he had no role in any meddling by Moscow, said Wednesday “the whole Russian thing” was merely an excuse by Democrats for losing the election.
“I think the uranium sale to Russia and the way it was done, so underhanded with tremendous amounts of money being passed, I actually think that’s Watergate, modern age,” Trump said Wednesday.
The final product, which contains salacious allegations against the president, has become part of ongoing congressional probes into Russian meddling in the 2016 election.

He said the election is “very hard for a Democrat to lose,” but Democrats nevertheless “lost it very badly and very easily.”

“They lost it by a lot,” he continued.
Before a lawyer representing Clinton’s campaign hired Fusion GPS to conduct the research in April 2016, a Republican client funded the venture.

It’s a very sad commentary on politics in this country.”
